intro: Hillia palmana, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy blooms from spring to summer. Hillia palmana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
